abstract: Former Dewey & LeBoeuf finance director Francis J Canellas testifies at criminal trial of firm's former top executives; describes how he and accused concocted four-year plan to manipulate company's records in order to make up more than $50 million shortfall; Canellas is one of seven former employees who have pleaded guilty and are working with Manhattan Dist Atty Cyrus R Vance Jr in case.
lead_paragraph: Francis J. Canellas, the former finance director of the bankrupt law firm, told jurors that a late-night meeting in December 2008 led to the manipulation of Dewey’s books.

headline.main: Officials at Dewey & LeBoeuf Manipulated Income Statements, Witness Testifies
headline.print_headline: Witness Testifies on Shortfall at Dewey

snippet: Francis J. Canellas, the former finance director of the bankrupt law firm, told jurors that a late-night meeting in December 2008 led to the manipulation of Dewey’s books.
